alert.note: Alert for Appling; Bacon; Brantley; Inland Glynn; Wayne (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 22 at 12:22AM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Glynn, Brantley, east central Bacon, Wayne and southeastern Appling Counties through 100 AM EDT... At 1221 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Ludowici to near Offerman to 9 miles northeast of Pearson. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds around 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Jesup, Nahunta, Gardi, Screven, Hickox, Thalmann, Everett, Raybon, Waynesville and Fort Mudge. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Appling; Bacon; Brantley; Inland Glynn; Wayne
